controller

Interface IImageController

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ImageController

    public interface IImageController
    An interface for the controller of the program, when run in script mode. Gets script input and calls the relevant methods from the program's model. Supports parsing a properly formatted .txt file that has different commands on each line, or any other Readable input with newline-separated commands, such as a String or standard input.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void commandReader(java.lang.Readable input)
      Starts up the controller by taking a readable object that specifies a series of image processing commands, to be run as a script.

    • Method Detail

      • commandReader

        void commandReader(java.lang.Readable input)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                   java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Starts up the controller by taking a readable object that specifies a series of image processing commands, to be run as a script. The input can be a string, a file, standard input, or any other class of input that implements the Readable interface. Individual commands must be on separate lines. This method will only parse the first argument on each line and pass the rest of the arguments to the appropriate method. If the first argument on a line cannot be matched, throws an exception.
        Parameters:
        input - the image processing script to be implemented
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If a command is invalid or if a submethod determines that the command's arguments are invalid.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If such an exception is passed up from a submethod.
